intro: Aiphanes chiribogensis, commonly known as the Chiriboga palm, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in inflorescences. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
